str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To fill, fulfill, complete. A prolonged form of a primary pleo to 'fill' (imbue, influence, supply); specially, to fulfil.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
